intro.title: The Little Gopher
story: Once upon a time, there was a cheerful little gopher with big, curious eyes and a tiny backpack slung over his shoulders. Today, he woke up brimming with excitement — he wanted to go on a grand adventure, but didn’t know where to start.

One of his friends once suggested traveling to New York to attend a mysterious event called "GothamGo". Rumor had it that there were endless snacks, quirky talks, and free swag (which gophers love more than carrots). But there was also a scary campfire story about the notorious Sticky Bandits who roamed the city. Probably just an urban legend… right?
Then again, Denver had always been on his mind — snowy slopes, warm cocoa, friendly faces, and even a conference dedicated to gophers like him. Perhaps it was the safer, cozier option.

options.text: That bandit story is just from Home Alone 2! Let’s hop to New York.
Better safe than sorry — let’s hit the slopes in Denver.

new-york.title: Visiting New York
story: The moment you and your gopher pal arrive in New York, the skyscrapers loom above like steel giants. Your gopher waves his tiny paw at taxis, but none stop — muttering something about 'pets'. As if gophers shed more than humans!
Undeterred, you order a ride from your phone. A few minutes later, a grumpy driver pulls up, glancing suspiciously at your furry friend before tossing your luggage in the trunk.
The ride is filled with the driver’s endless tales about how driving barely pays the bills, so you both put on earbuds and gaze out at the bustling streets.

Finally, you arrive at the conference hall for GothamGo. The badge table is friendly, but when you enter the main hall, you see something bizarre — a masked man in a cape with badly drawn abs… standing next to a person in a fox costume. What could they possibly be doing?

options.text: This is too weird — let’s head home.
Maybe big cities just have odd fashion. Let’s grab a seat.

debate.title: The Great Debate
story: As the crowd settles, the caped hero and the fox-faced debater begin exchanging words with dramatic hand gestures. The audience cheers and boos in waves, making it feel like a wrestling match without the ring.
You don’t understand all the details, but your gopher buddy is leaning forward, clearly fascinated. It feels like you’re expected to pick a side.

options.text: The caped one is the true hero!
This is awkward… let’s slip out quietly.

sean-kelly.title: Exit Stage Left
story: As you approach the fox-masked figure, he introduces himself as Sean Kelly. Curious, you look him up on your phone… only to find his online handle is 'StabbyCutyou'.
Your gopher buddy’s eyes widen. Maybe New York’s scary stories aren’t just stories.
Without another word, you grab your gopher pal and rush out. 'I’ll explain at the hotel,' you mutter.
That night, you both agree: adventure quota met. Home tomorrow.

mark-bates.title: Costume Time
story: The caped crusader introduces himself as Mark Bates. Despite the fake abs, he’s surprisingly friendly.
He’s been working on a project called Buffalo and needs a mascot. He shows you a buffalo costume — way too small for him.
Your gopher buddy tries it on and fits perfectly! Mark snaps photos, laughing about how Ashley McNamara designs the best costumes.
The rest of the trip is full of laughs and stories, but soon it’s your last night in the city.

denver.title: Hockey and Ski Slopes
story: You arrive in Denver to clear skies and snowy peaks. First stop — a hockey game! The Avalanche aren’t having the best season, but your gopher buddy waves a little foam finger, cheering like it’s the finals.
The next day, you’re on the ski slopes. The mountain air is crisp, and your gopher’s tiny ski goggles keep slipping down his nose.
You think about checking out GopherCon, but your buddy refuses — something about 'No Space Walks allowed' after seeing the conference website’s astronaut logo.
Before you know it, the week has flown by.

options.text: Time to pack for the journey home.

home.title: Home Sweet Home
story: Back home, your gopher pal thanks you for the trip. Maybe next year’s adventure will be even bigger — perhaps overseas? He’s heard gophers are all the rage in China.
